name: Compass Family Shelter
description: Compass Family Shelter offers families facing homelessness a safe, temporary place to stay and offers services designed to help families secure and maintain permanent housing. Services: - Emergency shelter for 22 families for up to six months - Intensive case management geared towards obtaining housing and stability - Individual, family, couples, and child therapy - Housing-related financial assistance - Follow up case management that focuses on homelessness prevention and family self-sufficienc

whatTheyOffer: Compass Family Shelter offers families facing homelessness a safe, temporary place to stay and offers services designed to help families secure and maintain permanent housing. Services: - Emergency shelter for 22 families for up to six months - Intensive case management geared towards obtaining housing and stability - Individual, family, couples, and child therapy - Housing-related financial assistance - Follow up case management that focuses on homelessness prevention and family self-sufficienc
howToGetIt: How to get connected: - In person: 37 Grove Street during operating hours to meet with an Access Point staff member for an eligibility assessment - By phone: Call 415-644-0504 and follow the instructions to be directed to Central City Access Point. Calls will be returned within two business days - Online: Learn more about Family Coordinated Entry and Family Access Points.
requirements: Homeless families and families at imminent risk for homelessness.
